labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to enable LLMs to interact with browser functionalities, allowing for the creation, management, and automation of browser instances and web operations. It provides tools for managing browser instances, groups, and performing various web interactions such as navigation, element manipulation, and page content extraction. The server also supports advanced configurations like fingerprint and proxy settings, making it suitable for tasks requiring automated browser control and web interaction.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is "Web Automation" because the server's core functionality revolves around automating browser operations and web interactions. Secondary labels include "Browser Automation" (for browser control specifically) and "API Integration" (for web service interactions). No custom label is needed as the predefined categories cover the server's functionality well.

tools.name: open-browser
tools.description: Open the browser, both environment and profile mean browser

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the browser to open

userId.description: The browser id of the browser to open

ipTab.description: The ip tab of the browser, 0 is not use ip tab, 1 is use ip tab, default is 0

launchArgs.description: The launch args of the browser, use chrome launch args, eg: ["--blink-settings=imagesEnabled=false","--disable-notifications"], or vista url, eg: ["https://www.adspower.net"]

clearCacheAfterClosing.description: The clear cache after closing of the browser, 0 is not clear cache after closing, 1 is clear cache after closing, default is 0

cdpMask.description: The cdp mask of the browser, 0 is not use cdp mask, 1 is use cdp mask, default is 0

userId.description: The browser id of the browser to stop, it is required when you want to stop the browser

domainName.description: The domain name of the browser, eg: facebook.com

openUrls.description: The open urls of the browser, eg: ["https://www.google.com"]

cookie.description: The cookie of the browser, eg: "[{"domain":".baidu.com","expirationDate":"","name":"","path":"/","sameSite":"unspecified","secure":true,"value":"","id":1}]"

username.description: The username of the browser, eg: "user"

password.description: The password of the browser, eg: "password"

groupId.description: The group id of the browser, must be a numeric string (e.g., "123"). You can use the get-group-list tool to get the group list or create a new group, or default is 0

name.description: The name of the browser, eg: "My Browser"

country.description: The country of the browser, eg: "CN"

sysAppCateId.description: The sys app cate id of the browser, you can use the get-application-list tool to get the application list

proxy_soft.description: The proxy soft of the browser

proxy_host.description: The proxy host of the browser, eg: 127.0.0.1

proxy_port.description: The proxy port of the browser, eg: 8080

proxy_user.description: The proxy user of the browser, eg: user

proxy_password.description: The proxy password of the browser, eg: password

proxy_url.description: The proxy url of the browser, eg: http://127.0.0.1:8080

global_config.description: The global config of the browser, default is 0

userProxyConfig.description: The user proxy config of the browser

automatic_timezone.description: The automatic timezone of the browser, default is 0

timezone.description: The timezone of the browser, eg: Asia/Shanghai

language.description: The language of the browser, eg: ["en-US", "zh-CN"]

flash.description: The flash of the browser, default is disabled

fonts.description: The fonts of the browser, eg: ["Arial", "Times New Roman"]

webrtc.description: The webrtc of the browser, default is disabled

version.description: The version of the browser, default is ua_auto

type.description: The type of the browser, default is chrome

browser_kernel_config.description: The browser kernel config of the browser, default is version: ua_auto, type: chrome

ua_system_version.description: The ua system version of the browser, eg: ["Android 9", "iOS 14"]

random_ua.description: The random ua config of the browser, default is ua_version: [], ua_system_version: []

tls_switch.description: The tls switch of the browser, default is 0

tls.description: The tls of the browser, if tls_switch is 1, you can set the tls of the browser, eg: "0xC02C,0xC030"

fingerprintConfig.description: The fingerprint config of the browser, default is automatic_timezone: 0, timezone: "", language: [], flash: "", fonts: [], webrtc: disabled, browser_kernel_config: ua_auto, random_ua: ua_version: [], ua_system_version: [], tls_switch: 0, tls: ""

groupName.description: The new name of the group

remark.description: The new remark of the group

groupName.description: The name of the group to search, use like to search, often used group name to find the group id, so eg: "test" will search "test" and "test1"

server_info_crawled.name: LocalAPI MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @AdsPower/local-api-mcp-typescript
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable LLMs to interact with browser functionalities like creating, updating, and managing browser instances seamlessly. Automate browser operations and enhance your workflow with advanced fingerprint and proxy configurations. Simplify your browser management tasks with intuitive commands and integrations.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@AdsPower/local-api-mcp-typescript/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
